Making @BeforeClass work only on static methods defeats the purpose o=
f this
feature.

Yes, @BeforeClass is meant to run before any test on this =
class is run, but
it is mostly used to initialize data that will be needed =
by each of these
test methods, and this data (and the test methods) are not=
 static.

The main use we see in TestNG for the equivalent of @BeforeClass =
is to
initialize costly data that is typically read-only and used subsequen=
tly in
these test methods (big XML file, JDBC connection, etc...).

I think=
 forcing it to run only on static methods is a mistake.
